items.title: Cerebral Aneurysm Treatment
items.shortDescription: Advanced coiling and flow diversion techniques to treat brain aneurysms with minimal invasiveness.
items.fullDescription: Our cerebral aneurysm treatment uses state-of-the-art endovascular techniques to repair weakened blood vessels in the brain. We offer coiling, flow diversion, and stent-assisted procedures tailored to each patient's specific condition.
benefits: Minimally invasive approach through a small groin incision
No open brain surgery required
Shorter hospital stays - often just 1-2 days
Faster recovery compared to traditional surgery
Reduced risk of complications
items.recovery: Most patients return to normal activities within 1-2 weeks. Follow-up imaging is performed at 3, 6, and 12 months to ensure the aneurysm remains secure.

items.title: Carotid Artery Stenting
items.shortDescription: Restore blood flow to the brain with our advanced carotid stenting procedure.
items.fullDescription: Carotid artery stenting is a minimally invasive procedure to open narrowed carotid arteries that supply blood to the brain. We use embolic protection devices and advanced stent technology to ensure safety and efficacy.
benefits: Prevents stroke by improving blood flow to the brain
Smaller incision than traditional carotid endarterectomy
Lower risk of nerve injury and wound complications
Suitable for patients who are high-risk for open surgery
Quick return to daily activities
items.recovery: Patients typically stay overnight for observation. Most return to normal activities within a few days, with follow-up ultrasound imaging at regular intervals.

items.title: Chronic Subdural Hematoma (cSDH)
items.shortDescription: Effective minimally invasive treatment for chronic subdural hematoma with Middle Meningeal Artery (MMA) embolization.
items.fullDescription: Chronic subdural hematoma (cSDH) is a collection of blood on the brain's surface beneath the outer covering. Our innovative MMA embolization procedure addresses the root cause by blocking the blood vessels that feed the hematoma membrane, preventing recurrence.
benefits: Non-surgical alternative to burr hole drainage
Significantly reduces recurrence rates
Performed under local anesthesia with sedation
Same-day or overnight procedure
Particularly effective for recurrent cSDH cases
items.recovery: Recovery is typically rapid, with most patients discharged the same day or next day. Follow-up CT scans monitor hematoma resolution over 4-8 weeks.

items.title: Trans-Venous Embolization
items.shortDescription: Specialized venous approach for treating complex vascular malformations and fistulas.
items.fullDescription: Trans-venous embolization is an advanced technique for treating vascular malformations and arteriovenous fistulas through the venous system. This approach is particularly valuable for dural arteriovenous fistulas and certain types of brain AVMs.
benefits: Alternative route when arterial access is challenging
More complete treatment of certain fistulas
Reduced radiation exposure compared to repeated arterial procedures
Lower complication risk for specific malformation types
Can be combined with arterial approaches for complex cases
items.recovery: Hospital stay varies based on the complexity of the procedure. Most patients are monitored for 24-48 hours with gradual return to normal activities over 1-2 weeks.

items.title: Trans-Arterial Embolization
items.shortDescription: Precision-targeted treatment for tumors, bleeding, and vascular malformations.
items.fullDescription: Trans-arterial embolization delivers therapeutic agents directly to target vessels through catheter-based techniques. We treat various conditions including uterine fibroids, prostate enlargement, traumatic bleeding, and hypervascular tumors.
benefits: Targeted treatment preserves surrounding healthy tissue
Effective for both benign and malignant conditions
Avoids open surgery in many cases
Can be repeated if necessary
Preserves organ function (e.g., uterus in fibroid treatment)
items.recovery: Most procedures are outpatient or require overnight observation. Recovery depends on the treated condition but is generally significantly faster than surgical alternatives.

items.title: EVAR & TEVAR
items.shortDescription: Endovascular repair of aortic aneurysms using advanced stent graft technology.
items.fullDescription: Endovascular Aortic Repair (EVAR) and Thoracic Endovascular Aortic Repair (TEVAR) are minimally invasive alternatives to open aortic surgery. We use custom-fitted stent grafts to reinforce weakened areas of the aorta without major chest or abdominal surgery.
benefits: Avoids large surgical incisions and chest/abdominal opening
Dramatically reduced blood loss
Shorter ICU and hospital stays
Lower mortality risk compared to open repair
Suitable for elderly and high-risk surgical patients
items.recovery: Most patients stay 2-3 days in hospital. Return to normal activities typically occurs within 2-4 weeks. Lifelong CT surveillance is required to monitor the stent graft.

items.question: What is endovascular treatment?
items.answer: Endovascular treatment is a minimally invasive procedure performed inside blood vessels using thin tubes called catheters. Instead of open surgery, doctors access the treatment area through a small puncture, typically in the groin. This approach offers faster recovery, less pain, and fewer complications compared to traditional surgery.

items.question: How do I know if I'm a candidate for endovascular treatment?
items.answer: Suitability depends on your specific condition, overall health, and the anatomy of your blood vessels. During your consultation, our specialists will review your medical history, perform necessary imaging studies, and discuss whether endovascular treatment is appropriate for you. We treat each patient individually to determine the best approach.

items.question: Is the consultation fee covered by insurance?
items.answer: Many insurance plans cover specialist consultations and endovascular procedures. We recommend contacting your insurance provider to verify coverage. Our administrative team can also assist with insurance inquiries and provide necessary documentation for claims.

items.question: How long does recovery typically take?
items.answer: Recovery times vary depending on the procedure and individual factors. Most endovascular procedures allow patients to return home the same day or after an overnight stay. Many patients resume normal activities within 1-2 weeks, which is significantly faster than recovery from open surgery.

items.question: What should I expect during my first visit?
items.answer: Your first visit includes a comprehensive medical evaluation, review of any previous imaging or test results, and a detailed discussion of your condition. Our specialists will explain treatment options, answer your questions, and develop a personalized care plan. Please bring your ID, insurance information, and a list of current medications.

items.question: Do you offer second opinions?
items.answer: Yes, we regularly provide second opinions for patients seeking additional guidance on their diagnosis or treatment options. Our specialists can review your case, imaging studies, and medical records to offer an expert perspective on the best course of action.
